title: Webhooks - Rapyd Developer Portal
content: Rapyd sends webhooks to notify your application when specific events occur. Webhooks are HTTP POST requests sent to a URL that you specify. To receive webhooks, you must configure a webhook endpoint URL in your Rapyd dashboard. When an event occurs, Rapyd sends a POST request to your endpoint with details about the event in the request body. You should respond with a 200 status code to acknowledge receipt.

title: Payment Methods - Rapyd Developer Portal
content: Rapyd supports multiple payment methods including credit cards, bank transfers, digital wallets, and cash payments. Each payment method has specific requirements and supported countries. Credit cards support 3D Secure authentication for enhanced security. Bank transfers can be processed through various local banking networks. Digital wallets include popular options like PayPal, Apple Pay, and Google Pay.

title: Collect Payments - Rapyd Developer Portal
content: To collect payments with Rapyd, you can use either the hosted checkout page or direct API integration. The hosted checkout page provides a secure, pre-built payment form that handles multiple payment methods. For direct API integration, you can create payments using the /v1/payments endpoint. All payment requests must include the amount, currency, and payment method details.

title: Authentication - Rapyd Developer Portal
content: Rapyd API uses access keys and secret keys for authentication. Each API request must include a signature header generated using HMAC-SHA256. The signature is created by concatenating the HTTP method, URL path, salt, timestamp, access key, secret key, and request body, then hashing with HMAC-SHA256. The salt should be a random string, and the timestamp should be the current Unix timestamp.

title: Testing - Rapyd Developer Portal
content: Rapyd provides a sandbox environment for testing your integration. Use test API keys and test payment methods to simulate transactions without processing real money. Test card numbers are available for different scenarios including successful payments, declined payments, and 3D Secure authentication. Webhook events can be triggered manually in the sandbox dashboard for testing webhook handling.
